text:
March 8, 1957
Dr. Burton Paulu
K U 0 Mt One Eddy Hall
University of Minnesota
Minneapolis, Minnesota
Dear Burton;
Let*s take the light things first. I hope to reach 101.
Comments regarding Seay conversations referred to his trip
to South America—that*3 where he is now. I offered to go along
if Kellogg paid my way. He said, *You*ve Just been turned down.*
Turned down on suggestion Kellogg send me with Seay. All was in
kidding, and related only to Indicate good mood of Seay.
Like you, VOA may come along some day, but I*m not too
hopeful about governmental agencies at times, including VOA.
We can discuss excise tax exemption on all-channel receivers.
It’s a matter of principle with me, on which I believe neither
NAEB nor JCET should take a stand. And, Ralph has been instructed
by JCET MOT to take a stand. He was Instructed NOT to testify,
no matter what his feelings are on the matter, ^nd, most of all,
it’s a dead duck anyhow. Congress will make no exception for
all-channel receivers. This, I believe. This, Heffeman concedes
for all practical purposes in talk with me. This, Senators on
the Foreign Commerce Committee believe, and have so expressed
themselves publicly.
On the Foundations committee, I agree that meeting would be
helpful, but I point out that anytime later than this week or
next week may be too late. So, what do we do. I feel we should
do this — let Schooley go ahead and explore and move as fast as
need be. And, I won't make definite moves without conferring and
getting approval, i.e., won't make specific requests* Any request
to Ford later than sometime within next two weeks may be too late
for July 1 funds. I don't have details, I'm giving you my best
guesses.
What does Paulu do? I suggest you get Foundations Committee
via letter, let me have items for which funds should be requested,
in order of preference if possible. Can send carbon to you. I
may need this dope within week or ten days. Then, final form of
request to Ford, Just for example, might be decided upon at
meeting you suggest for late March.
